timeline.message:
[QueryContext] Use QueryContext in all PlanNodes

Replace BrokerRequest with QueryContext in all PlanNodes
This change can save the redundant expression compilation of:
- Group by expressions
- Selection expreesions
- Order by expressions

Expressions in aggregation and filter will be addressed in the following PRs

[QueryContext] Use QueryContext in all PlanNodes

Replace BrokerRequest with QueryContext in all PlanNodes
This change can save the redundant expression compilation of:
- Group by expressions
- Selection expreesions
- Order by expressions

Expressions in aggregation and filter will be addressed in the following PRs

timeline.bodyText: So, this will go away in future PRs where instead of generating FilterQueryTree per FilterPlanNode (per segment), we will just use the already built FilterContext from QueryContext?
timeline.author: siddharthteotia

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need to convert the expression in QueryContext to TransformExpressionTree? I thought we are planning to get rid of TransformExpressionTree and replace with Expression in QueryContext. Is that part of future PRs?
timeline.author: siddharthteotia

replies.bodyText: Yes, that is correct, and will be done in the following PRs when replacing BrokerRequest in the functions (aggregation, transform).
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: I think we should add a TODO in this and related places that eventually (in the end state of this migration), this compilation to TransformExpressionTree per segment's plan node will not be needed.
timeline.author: siddharthteotia

replies.bodyText:
This will be cleaned up very soon, so I think the TODO is not necessary (or there will be too many TODOs added).
BTW, the toTransformExpressionTree() does not require any compilation, so the per-segment compilation for selection is already eliminated.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Why do we have to check for limit to extract order by expressions?
timeline.author: siddharthteotia

replies.bodyText: LIMIT 0 is solved with EmptySelectionOperator where order-by expressions are not fetched. Added some notes here.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: Do we need a unit test for this? Until now we were using a different implementation to convert to TET. Now we have this one. May be there is no need to add since long as all the end to end query execution tests pass, we are good?
timeline.author: siddharthteotia

replies.bodyText: Yes, and this is a temporary helper method which will be removed soon.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

timeline.bodyText: The limit should be set to the max (1, user specified limit) or default (10) if not specified. This can be done at the parse time
timeline.author: siddharthteotia

replies.bodyText: This is already done on the broker side, and we allow queries with LIMIT 0
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang

replies.bodyText: I don't know why we have EmptySelectionOperator. The broker should return an empty response right away with just the schema for LIMIT 0. Anyway, it is not related to this PR.
replies.author: siddharthteotia

replies.bodyText: The LIMIT 0 query is meant to get the schema of the table. When all table have schema and the schema is cached on broker side, we can directly return on broker side.
replies.author: Jackie-Jiang
